 HETEROSEXUAL QUESTIONNAIRE
 © Martin Rochlin, Ph.D. 
 
 This questionnaire is for self-avowed heterosexuals only. If you are not openly heterosexual, pass it on to a friend who is. Please try to answer the questions as candidly as possible. Your responses will be held in strict confidence and your anonymity fully protected.
 
 1. What do you think caused your heterosexuality?
 
 2. When and how did you first decide you were a heterosexual?
 
 3. Is it possible your heterosexuality is just a phase you may grow out of?
 
 4. Could it be that your heterosexuality stems from a neurotic fear of others of the same sex?
 
 5. If you've never slept with a person of the same sex, how can you be sure you wouldn't prefer that? 
 
 6. To whom have you disclosed your heterosexual tendencies? How did they react?
 
 7. Why do heterosexuals feel compelled to seduce others into their lifestyle?
 
 8. Why do you insist on flaunting your heterosexuality? Can't you just be what you are and keep it quiet?
 
 9. Would you want your children to be heterosexual, knowing the problems they'd face?
 
 10. A disproportionate majority of child molesters are heterosexual men. Do you consider it safe to expose children to heterosexual male teachers, pediatricians, priests, or scoutmasters?
 
 11. With all the societal support for marriage, the divorce rate is spiraling. Why are there so few stable relationships among heterosexuals?
 
 12. Why do heterosexuals place so much emphasis on sex?
 
 13. Considering the menace of overpopulation, how could the human race survive if everyone were heterosexual?
 
 14. Could you trust a heterosexual therapist to be objective? Don't you fear s/he might be inclined to influence you in the direction of her/his own leanings?
 
 15. Heterosexuals are notorious for assigning themselves and one another rigid, stereotyped sex roles. Why must you cling to such unhealthy role-playing?
 
 16. With the sexually segregated living conditions of military life, isn't heterosexuality incompatible with military service? 
 
 17. How can you enjoy an emotionally fulfilling experience with a person of the other sex when there are such vast differences between you? How can a man know what pleases a woman sexually or vice-versa?
 
 18. Shouldn't you ask your far-out straight cohorts, like skinheads and born-agains, to keep quiet? Wouldn't that improve your image?
 
 19. Why are heterosexuals so promiscuous?
 
 20. Why do you attribute heterosexuality to so many famous lesbian and gay people? Is it to justify your own heterosexuality?
 
 21. How can you hope to actualize your God-given homosexual potential if you limit yourself to exclusive, compulsive heterosexuality? 
 
 22. There seem to be very few happy heterosexuals. Techniques have been developed that might enable you to change if you really want to. After all, you never deliberately chose to be a heterosexual, did you? Have you considered aversion therapy?

HETEROSEXUAL QUESTIONNAIRE
 © Martin Rochlin, Ph.D. 
 
 This questionnaire is for self-avowed heterosexuals only. If you are not openly heterosexual, pass it on to a friend who is. Please try to answer the questions as candidly as possible. Your responses will be held in strict confidence and your anonymity fully protected.
 
 1. What do you think caused your heterosexuality? Natural, nondeleterious biological traits, You could say nature. You see all organisms proximal purpose is to reproduce therefore to be sexual with a partner with which you may reproduce is natural. 
 
 2. When and how did you first decide you were a heterosexual?
 When i learned the definition and realised that it applied to me because I was sexually attracted to the opposite sex.
 3. Is it possible your heterosexuality is just a phase you may grow out of?
 That is doubtful since it is the way nature made a properly oriented organism.
 
 4. Could it be that your heterosexuality stems from a neurotic fear of others of the same sex?
 Again doubtful since I have many friends of my same sex.
 
 5. If you've never slept with a person of the same sex, how can you be sure you wouldn't prefer that? 
 I am repulsed by the thought of it. That is a good indication that I would not like it.
 
 6. To whom have you disclosed your heterosexual tendencies? How did they react?
 All that I know, my spouse in particular, especially since our bodies are compatible and meant to engage in sexual activity. It is quite obvious that a penis and a vagina are complimentary structures.
 
 7. Why do heterosexuals feel compelled to seduce others into their lifestyle?
 Perhaps like all other organisms they have an aversion to mutation or less fit organisims. Before you blow your top, when I say fit I am using the definition of population genetics.
 
 8. Why do you insist on flaunting your heterosexuality? Can't you just be what you are and keep it quiet?
 I do not flaunt it, I have never specificaly told someone that I am heterosexual, nor do I feel that it is necessary. Nor have I thrown it in thier face so to speak.
 
 9. Would you want your children to be heterosexual, knowing the problems they'd face?
 Yes, if it is a problem to reproduce and raise you own children then nature has one major problem.
 
 10. A disproportionate majority of child molesters are heterosexual men. Do you consider it safe to expose children to heterosexual male teachers, pediatricians, priests, or scoutmasters? 
 You did not ask the valid question that is really at the root of this issue so I will do that for you. "Do you consider it safe to expose children to and have them in the unsupervised care of teachers, pediatricians, priests, or scoutmasters that are sexually attracted to people of your child's sex? Answer is No I do not consider it safe. Neither to leave my girl with a heterosexual male nor my boy with a homosexual male. 
 
 
 11. With all the societal support for marriage, the divorce rate is spiraling. Why are there so few stable relationships among heterosexuals?
 Because our society has a distorted view of marriage and what is really of worth. I could be much more specific here but this is the underlying reason.
 
 12. Why do heterosexuals place so much emphasis on sex?
 It is the way we propagate our species as well as express love for our spouse. At least these are the correct reasons for sex.
 
 13. Considering the menace of overpopulation, how could the human race survive if everyone were heterosexual?
 Just as it does and has since the dawn of man.
 
 14. Could you trust a heterosexual therapist to be objective? Don't you fear s/he might be inclined to influence you in the direction of her/his own leanings?
 Therapists are rarely objective thier paradigm will always influence their work. So the real question is do you agree with their paradigm?
 
 15. Heterosexuals are notorious for assigning themselves and one another rigid, stereotyped sex roles. Why must you cling to such unhealthy role-playing?
 Because of the physical difference between the sexual organs of males and females and the way in which we engage in reproduction. THese two factors consign us to specific sexual roles. Once again nature rears its ugly head.
 
 16. With the sexually segregated living conditions of military life, isn't heterosexuality incompatible with military service?
 No, however it may be incompatible with having sex with the opposite sex. Which is not what the millitary is for. 
 
 17. How can you enjoy an emotionally fulfilling experience with a person of the other sex when there are such vast differences between you? How can a man know what pleases a woman sexually or vice-versa?
 An inane question that deserves no answer for it is obvious. 
 
 18. Shouldn't you ask your far-out straight cohorts, like skinheads and born-agains, to keep quiet? Wouldn't that improve your image?
 It may.
 
 19. Why are heterosexuals so promiscuous?
 Because society is losing its moral base.
 
 20. Why do you attribute heterosexuality to so many famous lesbian and gay people? Is it to justify your own heterosexuality?
 It is probably because most people are heterosexuals as it is the natural way to be born, therefore we assume that a person is heterosexual untill evidence shows otherwise.
 
 21. How can you hope to actualize your God-given homosexual potential if you limit yourself to exclusive, compulsive heterosexuality? 
 There is no evidence that God desires us to be homosexual, there is however evidence to the contrary.
 
 22. There seem to be very few happy heterosexuals. Techniques have been developed that might enable you to change if you really want to. After all, you never deliberately chose to be a heterosexual, did you? Have you considered aversion therapy?
 Heterosexuality is the natural way of sexuality as evidenced by reproductive methods as well as societal necessities therefore this question has no logical basis.

 But yes, it is quite possible... except I know of no mammals that have exlusively gay populations (excepting when they lock up lab a group f all girl mice together). So, whilst the 'act' might be 'natural', that is, in the wild, the 'lifestyle' is not.

 
 I know of no mammals that are homophobic either.
montalban

I know of no mammals that are homophobic either.

 
 There wouldn't be. As there are no homosexual mammals (I assume you're not including humans), there's no need to 'protect' the urge to mate.
 
 Thus we now find that only humans have 'dedicated' homosexuals. It must be therefore deemed 'un-natural'.
 
 The singular instances of the act are 'natural' as we find them in nature. But to be dedicated to homosexuality is not. Thus, in humans, as a reaction against this un-natural behaviour, we have people who react to maintain the urge to breed.
 
 
 Perhaps bi-sexuality is natural. We can discuss that too if you will :)
mizmaxx

Thus we now find that only humans have 'dedicated' homosexuals. It must be therefore deemed 'un-natural'.

 
 Sure. If anything that animals don't do is unnatural, lots of human things are unnatural. That doesn't mean they are bad.
 
 I don't really find the term "natural" very useful for this reason- also because arguably every concious human action is "unnatural". Conversely, if we are natural, than everything we do must be also save intervention by some divine being.
 
 
Perhaps bi-sexuality is natural. We can discuss that too if you will

 
 Now we're talking. What is it with people and their genital fetishes? "I can only fall in love with someone if they have a penis"... How strange and superficial. I'm the kind of person who doesn't look between people's legs to determine if they are a good potential life partner.
Tastyfish

Bonobos are quite often gay (not the majority but observed quite a lot), it is good behaviour in some circumstances where not all the organisms will mate. A lot of wild animals have been observed to be homosexual, BBC has rolls and rolls of it where it has been cut out of documentaries.
 
 Genes for it could still easily be passed on if the trait is linked to one that is benefical to females.
jitobear

Mizzmaxx - I just wanted to say that the questionaire was fabulous. Sad how few people got the point though.
 
 And for the record - I despise it when people equate homosexuality with pedophilia.
 
 Homosexuals like other grown ups of the same sex. 
 
 Pedophiles like children - some like same sex, some like opposit sex - but all like children. To focus energy that needs to be spent protecting children from pedophiles on gays will harass a lot of people innocent of this atrocity and leave a lot of children unprotected. Find another way to justify your hate.
mjames

Thank you MizzMax for your intelligent contributions to this exhausting forum of idiocy.
 
 I've often wondered about the population theory regarding homosexuality among humans. After all, it is humans that are proliferating and damaging the resources of this planet by incessant "procreation", gobbling up all the plant life and taking up too much space, not the animals. Since we are at the top of the food chain, other biological forces seem reasonable, hence homosexuality and infertility.
 
 The Earth has an amazing way of healing itself and if ridding itself of mankind as its most threatening occupant, hooray!
smggie

[QUOTE=montalban]There wouldn't be. As there are no homosexual mammals (I assume you're not including humans), there's no need to 'protect' the urge to mate.
 
 Thus we now find that only humans have 'dedicated' homosexuals. It must be therefore deemed 'un-natural'.
 There are few dedicated homosexuals in the animal world because there are few monogamous (dedicated) minded animals. And in those that are monogamous, yes, there are long lasting gay couples. do some research. Penguins would be a good place to start (not mammal, i know.).
 
 And homosexuality does not 'weaken' a social animal. Instead, decreased competition and altruistic behaviors will help ensure the fitness of existing offspring, helping the species.
 
 So what does it mean to have a degree in human bio anyways?
